channel.title: Homes on Balakumar Sundaralingam
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Balakumar Sundaralingam

item.title: Relaxed-Rigidity Constraints
item.description: Performing In-grasp manipulation through purely kinematic trajectory optimization.

I am a Research Scientist in the Seattle Robotics Lab at NVIDIA Research. I successfully defended my Ph.D. in Computing (Robotics) at the University of Utah, advised by Prof. Tucker Hermans. In the past, I have worked on mobile robots, specifically on mapping with LIDAR and reactive collision avoidance. I have also built robotic systems ranging from mobile robots to dexterous manipulation systems. My research interests are on topics enabling robots to interact with novel objects without requiring extensive task-specific human engineering.

Research Code & Datasets Some of my research involves robots interacting with objects in the real world. I have collected RGB-D, robot state and other sensing available during robot execution for future use. I have made these datasets available along with quick implementations(mostly python) of the main contributions of associated research article. Reach out to me if you are looking for something specific from my research that’s not available here and I will share them with you.
